title: Peaches and nectarines - effects of new technology

content.description:
Peaches and nectarines are substitute goods, and both are produced under conditions of competitive long-run equilibrium.

Joyce, a producer in the peach industry, discovers a technological breakthrough that only reduces the cost of producing peaches. Explain how the change in technology will affect each of the following for Joyce.

Quantity of peaches produced

Price of peaches

Short-run profits

Now assume that all other peach-producing firms adopt the new technology. Explain how the adoption of the new technology will affect each of the following in the peach-producing industry.

Price of peaches

Quantity of peaches produced

This new technology is not applicable to the production of nectarines. Explain how the changes that occurred in the peach industry will affect each of the following in the nectarine industry.

Price of nectarines

Quantity of nectarines

The graph above depicts the supply and demand curves for workers in the nectarine industry before the technological breakthrough in the peach industry.

Explain how the technological breakthrough in the peach industry will affect each of the following in the labor market for nectarine workers.

Wage rate for nectarine workers

Number of nectarine workers hired
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.
